revised_title: Seismic Refraction Survey in the Western Approaches to the English Channel
tldr: A seismic refraction survey was conducted in the Western Approaches to the English Channel, revealing two distinct geological sequences. The first sequence consists of tectonized, metamorphic layers with igneous intrusions, while the second sequence comprises nearly horizontal layers of secondary and younger sediments. The study also identified a possible acoustic unconformity that may correspond to a geological unconformity between Palaeozoic and Mesozoic strata.
